rounds.event: The search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 is announced to be suspended.
deaths: Tirrel Burton, American football player and coach
Colo, American western lowland gorilla, first gorilla born in captivity and oldest recorded

rounds.event: Anton Chekhov's The Cherry Orchard receives its premiere performance at the Moscow Art Theatre.
births: Hem Vejakorn, Thai painter and illustrator

rounds.event: Black Panther Party members Bunchy Carter and John Huggins are killed during a meeting in Campbell Hall on the campus of UCLA.
births: Lukas Moodysson, Swedish director, screenwriter, and author

rounds.event: World War II: Allied forces launch the first of four assaults on Monte Cassino with the intention of breaking through the Winter Line and seizing Rome, an effort that would ultimately take four months and cost 105,000 Allied casualties.
births: Ann Oakley, English sociologist, author, and academic

rounds.event: The SS-Totenkopfverbände begin the evacuation of the Auschwitz concentration camp as the Red Army closes in.
births: Javed Akhtar, Indian poet, playwright, and composer
Anne Cutler, Australian psychologist and academic
